materials.raw_text: 6 grams of Arsenic (As), 1 gram of Sodium (Na), 2 grams of Neodymium (Nd), 6 grams of Ruthenium (Ru)

sourcing.instructions: Arsenic: Obtain from chemical supply companies or specialized metal suppliers. Sodium: Purchase from laboratory supply stores or chemical suppliers. Neodymium: Available through rare earth metal suppliers. Ruthenium: Source from metal suppliers or online marketplaces specializing in chemical elements.
steps: Arsenic: Obtain from chemical supply companies or specialized metal suppliers. Sodium: Purchase from laboratory supply stores or chemical suppliers. Neodymium: Available through rare earth metal suppliers. Ruthenium: Source from metal suppliers or online marketplaces specializing in chemical elements.

1. In a well-ventilated fume hood, wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE). 2. Weigh each ingredient precisely using an analytical balance. 3. In a clean, dry glass beaker, combine 6 grams of Arsenic with 1 gram of Sodium. 4. Stir the mixture gently until uniform. 5. Next, add 2 grams of Neodymium and 6 grams of Ruthenium to the beaker. 6. Continue stirring until all components are well integrated. 7. Transfer the mixture to a high-purity crucible suitable for melting metals.
preparation.raw_text: 1. In a well-ventilated fume hood, wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE). 2. Weigh each ingredient precisely using an analytical balance. 3. In a clean, dry glass beaker, combine 6 grams of Arsenic with 1 gram of Sodium. 4. Stir the mixture gently until uniform. 5. Next, add 2 grams of Neodymium and 6 grams of Ruthenium to the beaker. 6. Continue stirring until all components are well integrated. 7. Transfer the mixture to a high-purity crucible suitable for melting metals.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200°C. 2. Place the crucible in the furnace. 3. Maintain this temperature for 30 minutes to ensure proper melting and alloy formation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200°C. 2. Place the crucible in the furnace. 3. Maintain this temperature for 30 minutes to ensure proper melting and alloy formation.

steps: 1. After the heating period, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature. 2. This may take approximately 3 to 4 hours. 3. Do not remove the crucible until the furnace is completely cool to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating period, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature. 2. This may take approximately 3 to 4 hours. 3. Do not remove the crucible until the furnace is completely cool to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cool, carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond file to smooth the edges and surfaces to achieve a desired finish. 3. If necessary, apply a protective sealant to the surface to enhance durability. 4. Store the finished sample in a dry, secure location away from reactive materials.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cool, carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond file to smooth the edges and surfaces to achieve a desired finish. 3. If necessary, apply a protective sealant to the surface to enhance durability. 4. Store the finished sample in a dry, secure location away from reactive materials.
